div1.p:
State of Washington County of Clarke. } SS
Exhibit No. 2.
I, C. D. Bowles, first being duly sworn according to law, depose and say as follows: I accuse M. L. Coovert, of Vancouver, Clarke County, State of Washington, of the crime of selling and furnishing cigarettes, contrary to the statute in such cases made and provided, committed as follows: Said M. L. Coovert is a retail tobacco dealer doing business in Vancouver, County of Clarke, State of Washington, and on Friday, June the 9th, 1893, at his said place of business in said city of Vancouver, the said M. L. Coovert did sell and furnish to one C. L. McDonald one package of cigarettes, more particularly described as follows:
a slide pastboard for containing the paper wrapped cigarettes and marked 'Vanity Fair' cigarettes and having upon in the stautory caution notice and the U.S. Revenue stamp duly cancelled and the number of manufacturing district and place.
which said packafe of vigarettes and is of the value of five cents Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9th day of June 1893. C. D. Bowles H. R. Caples County Clerk.
